info.title: Scheduler
info.description: Scheduler webhooks allow developers to receive events for [Scheduler](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/zoom-scheduler/).

requestBody.description:
# scheduler.scheduled_event_created
The **Scheduled event created** event triggers every time one user schedules an event with the scheduler host through the public booking page.



**Event type**: `scheduler.scheduled_event_created`

event_ts.description: The timestamp when the event was created.

account_id.description: The account ID of the scheduled event host.

user_id.description: The user ID of the scheduled event host.

invitee_email.description: The email address of the user who schedule the event.

invitee_first_name.description: The first name of the user who schedule the event.

invitee_last_name.description: The last name of the user who schedule the event.

manage_url.description: The URL for the user to reschedule or cancel the scheduled event.

question.description: The question in the booking page.
question.example: Please share anything that will help prepare for our meeting.

scheduled_event.description: The information of the scheduled event.

total.description: The total count of invitees in the event.

active.description: The active invitees count in the event.

limit.description: The limit of the maximum invitees for the event.

end_date_time.description: The scheduled event's end date time.

oneOf.title: zoom
oneOf.description: All the information about the Zoom meeting.

zoom_join_url.description: The URL to join a meeting.

zoom_meeting_data.description: The extra info for the meeting.

zoom_meeting_id.description: The unique identifier of the meeting in string format. This field is also known as the meeting number.

zoom_personal_meeting_id.description: The personal meeting ID in string format.

oneOf.title: custom
oneOf.description: All the information about the custom location.

custom_location.description: The information for a custom location.

external_location.description: The meeting details in scheduled event.

kind.description: The type of meeting specified in the schedule.

meeting_id.description: The unique identifier of the meeting in string format.

personal_meeting_id.description: The personal meeting id in string format.

start_date_time.description: The scheduled event's start date time.

status.description: The status of event: confirmed or cancelled.

updated.description: The moment the scheduled event was updated.

created.description: The moment the scheduled event was created.

meeting_notes.description: The meeting notes of the scheduled event.

tracking.description: The information to track the source of invitee. Only have this when add UTM parameters.

utm_source.description: This field identifies which site sent the traffic, and is a required parameter

utm_medium.description: This field identifies what type of link was used, such as Pay-per-click or email.

utm_campaign.description: This field identifies a specific product promotion or strategic campaign.

utm_content.description: This field identifies what specifically was clicked to bring the user to the site, such as a banner ad or a text link. It is often used for A/B testing and content-targeted ads.

utm_term.description: This field identifies te search terms.

rescheduled.description: Whether it's from a reschedule request.

created.description: The moment the scheduled request was created.

text_phone_number.description: The phone number of the invitee to receive text reminders.

event_ts.description: The timestamp when the event was created.

account_id.description: The account ID of the scheduled event host.

user_id.description: The user ID of the scheduled event host.

invitee_email.description: The email address of the user who schedule the event.

invitee_first_name.description: The first name of the user who schedule the event.

invitee_last_name.description: The last name of the user who schedule the event.

manage_url.description: The URL for the user to reschedule or cancel the scheduled event.

question.description: The question in the booking page.
question.example: Please share anything that will help prepare for our meeting.

total.description: The total count of invitees in the event.

active.description: The active invitees count in the event.

limit.description: The limit of the maximum invitees for the event.

end_date_time.description: The scheduled event's end date time.

requestBody.description:
# scheduler.scheduled_event_canceled
The **Scheduled event canceled** event triggers every time the host or booker cancels the scheduled event.



**Event type**: `scheduler.scheduled_event_canceled`

event_ts.description: The timestamp when the event was created.

account_id.description: The account ID of the scheduled event host.

user_id.description: The user ID of the scheduled event host.

invitee_email.description: The email address of the user who schedule the event.

invitee_first_name.description: The first name of the user who schedule the event.

invitee_last_name.description: The last name of the user who schedule the event.

manage_url.description: The URL for the user to reschedule or cancel the scheduled event.

canceled_by.description: The name or email address of the canceler.

canceler_type.description: The user type of the person who canceled.

cancel_at.description: The date and time to cancel this scheduled event.

reason.description: The reason to cancel this scheduled event.

question.example: Please share anything that will help prepare for our meeting.

scheduled_event.description: The information of the scheduled event.

attendees.description: The hosts of the scheduled event.

total.description: The total count of invitees in the event.

active.description: The active invitees count in the event.

limit.description: The limit of the maximum invitees in the event.

end_date_time.description: The scheduled event's end date time.

utm_source.description: This field identifies which site sent the traffic, and is a required parameter

utm_medium.description: This field identifies what type of link was used, such as Pay-per-click or email.

utm_campaign.description: This field identifies a specific product promotion or strategic campaign.

utm_content.description: This field identifies what specifically was clicked to bring the user to the site, such as a banner ad or a text link. It is often used for A/B testing and content-targeted ads.

text_phone_number.description: The phone number of invitee to receive text reminder.
